Wonderful game with excellent story and world design. Regret that I just played this game for only several hours many years ago. 
I just find that this is a masterpiece after replaying it in 2021. 
I strongly recommend it~
Ğ¡ÑĞ¶ĞµÑ‚ Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ¿, Ğ³Ñ€Ğ°Ñ„Ğ¸ĞºĞ° Ğ½Ğ° ÑƒÑ€Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ½Ğµ ,  Ñ‚ÑĞ½ĞµÑ‚ Ğ´Ğ°Ğ¶Ğµ Ğ½Ğ° ĞºĞ¾Ğ½ÑĞµÑ€Ğ²Ğµ Ğ²Ğ¾Ğ±Ñ‰ĞµĞ¼ ÑÑ‚Ğ¾Ğ¸Ñ‚ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ¸Ğ³Ñ€Ğ°Ñ‚ÑŒ

I found out about this series from a certain video. Now that I've played it, Elizabeth's voicelines just triggered me some nostalgia.

Thank you, Zone-sama.

Arguably the best of the BioShock series, Infinite serves as a prequel to the earlier two installments.

Offering a compelling and enigmatic story, lots of combat using a mix of weapons and abilities, and the chance to loot, this game has a fantastic soundtrack and an art style that holds up well even years after the game's release.

In short, this is a beautiful top-tier thought-provoking game.

Seriously one of the best games to ever exist in the video game industry. Amazing and beautiful art style, near-flawless gameplay, and one of the most thought-provoking storylines to ever grace a video game.
One of the best games I have played in a very long time. Just... wow.
Awesome game - what a story line!

This may be one of the best FPS that I've played in my life. The gameplay is amazing and the visual art is breathtaking. Definitely a masterpiece you should try.

I honestly can't describe the reaction I got from finishing this game, everything about the story is just incredible
Lay that on top of some great gameplay, and you got yourself a game well worth the money

*Also you can keep using the starter pistol effectively throughout the whole duration of the game i'd say that's pretty neat*

My scores for this game
Story : â­/10
It had a very beautiful story. The story of the game is before Bioshock 1, and the part about playing with Elizabeth was really great.
Graphics : â­/10
The game graphics were great, especially in a city in the clouds
Musics : 10/10
Songs that are really great in the game and immerse me in the game.
Details : 10/10
The details in the game are very careful and early in the game I had a lot of fun in the city.
Game play : â­/10
It was one of the best shooters I have ever experienced.
Variety : 10/10
The variety in the choice of story was really great
Characterization : 10/10
The characters in the game, especially Elizabeth, were great
Optimization : â­/10
The game was very optimistic.
Bugs : Elizabeth being teleported ;/
Overall score : â­/10
100% recommended for everyone

I gave up following the timelines

A mediocre, on-rails, by the numbers first-person shooter that looks magnificent but lacks in gameplay and world-building compared to better games both from before and after it was released. Despite featuring abilities (which I don't care a lot for compared to say those in Borderlands 3 for example), the moment-to-moment gameplay lacks depth even compared to 1993's Doom which had more short-term tactical and long-term strategy within a level than this.

A good example of the shalowness of the gameplay is the fact that higher difficulties just bump up damage numbers to unreasonable levels so that you die more and it takes more tries to progressively clear an area, keeping all of the progress you've made since your death. It's not about being rewarded with a better understanding of enemy composition, behavior and how to use the environment to your advantage but about being a one-man cannonfodder squad throwing yourself at enemies enough times to get to the next area.

While the game still looks great in 2021, especially on Ultra, the texture streaming makes popping a constant issue at any part of the game so even if your video card can handle maximum settings, it won't do any good without a solid-state drive to keep up with the streaming bandwidth, producing subpar results even below Ultra settings.

I imagine much like Doom 3 back in the day was widely criticized for, sacrificing gameplay in the altar of graphics must have been a huge trade-off here. Combat areas are cramped and short, with so many walls and obstacles to limit the depth of view that even outdoor areas feel like rat mazes and by-and-large play no differently than indoor areas. You can't read the layout of an area easily or see where enemies are coming from until they're already shooting at you - pair that with the damage output of higher difficulties and it's a poor experience.

Compared to similar but much better first-person shooters from Doom 1 to Half-Life 2 to Borderlands 3, this is an extremely shallow experience with basically zero tactical thinking involved. It's all about moving to the next set-piece with new toys now and then to keep you entertained. Given the Overwhelmingly Positive rating on Steam, I guess being more like a movie and less like a game is what people want nowadays anyway.

While the world seems pretty interesting at first, the world-building lacks subtletly and is very hamfisted in its approach. Some of it works, some of it doesn't with the impressive graphics doing most of the heavy lifting. The world quickly gets annoying when every room you walk into you need to press your Use key no less than a dozen times to pick up health and mana items that will recharge 10% of your bar each, not to mention individual coins all around the map when any given item costs 50+ coins. It quickly destroys any sense of realism and immersion.

What possible negative aspect would the pickups have if you just picked them up by touching or standing nearby them? But I guess that in a game so void of any depth in gameplay, mashing buttons at random on every single room you enter is considered a core part of the main gameplay loop. Imagine being one of the extremely talented artists who poured their hearts out into the amazing assets in this game only for the player to skip through all of them rushing to spam buttons on every angle they can find rather than take it all in.

It's not like 1993's Doom had pick-ups or deep tactical first-person combat figured out already or anything...
I don't understand why is it so hightly rated but still good !

The game is amazing with complicated stroyline which is answered at the end. This is more than a purely FPS, the scenery is fascinating when in open-air environment, the combat's speed is sometimes high (which may causes nausea or dizziness), the optional quests are not really challenging but they give reasonable rewards, the weapon's style suit the timeline of the game, which is around 1900s, the combination between many types of vigor is really cool.Elizabeth, the essential part of the game, who is really helpful and is the root of the 'plot twist' which happened at the end of the game. Recommended playing the game not only  because of it is a FPS game, but also for the rich storyline it contains.

Also, the DLC Burial at sea is cool if u interested in it.
